subject: Personal Finance
title: Money Supply and Inflation
description: A micro-lesson that makes Money Supply and Inflation usable.

hook.text: Print twice the money with the same goods available. Each dollar is now worth half as much.

buildup.text: Milton Friedman said inflation is 'always and everywhere a monetary phenomenon.'

discovery.text: When central banks create money faster than the economy grows, inflation follows.

twist.text: But after 2008, central banks printed trillions and inflation stayed low for a decade. It's complicated.

climax.text: Money supply matters, but so do velocity, expectations, and where the money goes.

punchline.text: More money doesn't always mean more inflation.

quiz.question: Who said inflation is 'always a monetary phenomenon'?
